titles: The countrey-mans vive le roy. Or, His joyfull exaltation for King Charles his restoration, in a dialogue between Dick a plough-man, and Jack a shepherd. With Jacks epigram upon Englands grand traytor.
notes: Verse: "Come, Jack shake off thy old disguise,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Charles --  II, --  King of England, 1630-1685 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
